summary: This document is a chain of emails between a Senior Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and an Associate Warden regarding an interview request. The OIG is investigating the August 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The agent requests documentation and an interview concerning events around August 10, 2019, including camera system issues and an inmate transfer.

persons.name: Forrest Ci
persons.context: The Associate Warden at MCC New York during the Epstein incident in August 2019, later transferred to FCC Forrest City, AR. He is being interviewed by the OIG regarding documentation he may have gathered following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Efrain
persons.context: An inmate whose transfer from the MCC on August 9, 2019, is of interest to the OIG investigation into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General was actively investigating the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2021, over two years after the event.

Associate Warden Forrest Ci, who had oversight of Correctional Services at MCC New York starting August 8, 2019, stated he was not informed of any systemic camera issues at the facility around the time of Epstein's death.
The investigation sought specific documentation related to Epstein being found unresponsive, the transfer of inmate Efrain on August 9, 2019, and camera system issues between August 8-10, 2019.
The email chain reveals procedural steps, including the provision of an OIG Warnings and Assurances Form to inform the interviewee the conversation is voluntary.
Forrest Ci had been transferred from MCC New York to FCC Forrest City, Arkansas, by the time of this correspondence in late 2021.
